required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Tafoxiparin to Treat Primary Slow Progress of Labor Including Prolonged Latent Phase and Labor Arrest
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Dose-Finding Study to Evaluate the Effect of Continuous Infusion of Tafoxiparin as an Adjunct Treatment to Oxytocin for up to 36 Hours in Term Pregnant, Nulliparous Women to Treat Primary Slow Progress of Labor Including Prolonged Latent Phase and Labor Arrest

brief_summary.textblock: The study will be designed as a double-blind, placebo-controlled, parallel-group, dose-finding study with one group treated with placebo and three groups treated with tafoxiparin in three different infusion concentration levels, respectively. The intravenous infusion will be initiated by a pre-defined bolus dose infusion.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objective
To assess the dose-response relationship of tafoxiparin on the labor time defined as the time from the start of continuous infusion of tafoxiparin/placebo as an Adjunct Treatment to Oxytocin, until partus in term-pregnant, nulliparous women requiring labor augmentation due to Primary Slow Progress of Labor including prolonged latent phase and Labor Arrest.
Secondary objectives
To assess the safety and efficacy of tafoxiparin based on the safety and secondary efficacy parameters evaluated in the protocol. PK (pharmacokinetic) response in pregnant women during labor.
Methodology
All term-pregnant, nulliparous women presenting to the delivery ward are potential study patients unless they have already been enrolled in another clinical study. Subjects may be pre-informed about the study through the use of advertisements or information at the physician/midwife visits during pregnancy and at hospital admission.
The whole study includes the following steps:
- Screening and Baseline including informed consent and randomization
- Labor
- Discharge
- Follow-up at 8 (+/-1)weeks - End of study
- Safety follow up of infant at 6 months, +/-4 weeks, by telephone interview

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Time from start of infusion of tafoxiparin/placebo until vaginal partus
primary_outcome.time_frame: Interval from start of study drug administration to vaginal delivery (hours, up to 36 hours )
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint (time from first infusion to vaginal partus) will be summarized graphically for each treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates. In addition to this statistical comparison between the treatments will be performed using the analysis of variance technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety will be evaluated through rate and frequency of adverse events and serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion ( 6 months, +/-4 weeks after delivery)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be evaluated through rate and frequency of adverse events and serious adverse events, complete and symptom-directed physical evaluations, vital signs, safety blood samples (hematology and clinical chemistry), and rate of withdrawals from the study and/or the study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from cervical dilatation of 4 cm and progress of labor until vaginal partus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval from 4 cm of cervical dilatation to vaginal delivery (hours, up to 36 hours )

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women with dystocia/protracted labor defined as ≥8, 10, 12 and 14 hours of established labor (4 cm of cervical dilation to vaginal partus )
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval from 4 cm of cervical dilatation to vaginal delivery (hours, up to 36 hours )

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women with dystocia/protracted labor defined as ≥8, 10, 12 and 14 hours from start of study drug infusion to vaginal partus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Interval from start of study drug administration to vaginal delivery (hours, up to 36 hours )

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women with caesarean sections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration to caesarean section (hours, up to 36 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women undergoing instrumental deliveries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration to instrumental delivery (hours, up to 36 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of analgesia (N2O, epidural, pudendal nerve block)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration to any delivery (hours, up to 36 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women with postpartum hemorrhage > 1000 ml
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration and up to 7 days or discharge whichever comes first (days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Fetal outcome measured as Apgar score (5 min) ≤ 7 points, Base Excess > -12 and referral to NICU (neonatal intensive care unit) (for > 48 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration and up to 7 days or discharge whichever comes first (days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Uterine hyperstimulation with fetal heart rate changes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration to any delivery (hours, up to 36 hours)
From start of study drug administration through study completion (6 months +- 4 weeks after delivery)

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of Oxytocin (no. of mls. according to instructions)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study drug administration to any delivery (hours, up to 36 hours)
From start of study drug administration to any delivery (hours, up to 36 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of study drug in plasma at one time point

arm_group.description: The subjects will receive intravenous infusion of DF01 (tafoxiparin) in low dose as an Adjunct Treatment to Oxytocin for up to 36 hours initiated by a pre-defined bolus dose as a therapeutic intervention until delivery

The subjects will receive intravenous infusion of DF01 (tafoxiparin) in medium dose as an Adjunct Treatment to Oxytocin for up to 36 hours initiated by a pre-defined bolus dose as a therapeutic intervention until delivery

The subjects will receive intravenous infusion of DF01 (tafoxiparin) in high dose as an Adjunct Treatment to Oxytocin for up to 36 hours initiated by a pre-defined bolus dose as a therapeutic intervention until delivery
The subjects will receive intravenous infusion of placebo as an Adjunct Treatment to Oxytocin for up to 36 hours initiated by a pre-defined bolus dose as a therapeutic intervention until delivery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant women of ≥18 to ≤45 years of age
2. Nulliparous
3. Gestational age > 36 weeks + 6 days confirmed by ultrasound
4. Experience slow progress of labor including prolonged latent phase and labor arrest (according to the respective definitions) etc
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects with secondary slow progress or secondary labor arrest
2. BMI≥35 during first trimester of pregnancy
3. Breech presentation or other abnormal presentations etc
